text: is a retired Japanese ultramarathon and marathon runner who won the bronze medal in the marathon at the 1993 World Championships with a time of 2:31:01. Her personal best time is 2:26:09, achieved when she won the 1994 Osaka Ladies' Marathon. She is the female world record holder in the ultramarathon of 100 kilometres with a time of 6:33:11, which was set on June 25, 2000 at the Lake Saroma Ultramarathon, an official IAAF(International Association of Athletics Federations) race held annually in Hokkaido, Japan.IAAF:100 kilometres records ==Achievements== {| |- !colspan="6"|Representing |- |1990 |World Junior Championships |Plovdiv, Bulgaria |11th |10,000m |35:23.47 |- |1993 |World Championships |Stuttgart, Germany |bgcolor="cc9966" | 3rd |Marathon |2:31:01 |- |1994 |Osaka Ladies Marathon |Osaka, Japan |bgcolor="gold" | 1st |Marathon |2:26:09 |- |1996 |Hokkaido Marathon |Sapporo, Japan |bgcolor="gold" | 1st |Marathon |2:31:21 |- |1997 |World Championships |Athens, Greece |29th |Marathon |2:45:19 |- |2000 |Osaka Ladies Marathon |Osaka, Japan |6th |Marathon |2:28:01 |- |2001 |Nagoya Marathon |Nagoya, Japan |5th |Marathon |2:27:01 |} ==References== ==External links== * Category:1971 births Category:Living people Category:Japanese ultramarathon runners Category:Japanese female marathon runners Category:Sportspeople from Ōita Prefecture Category:World Athletics Championships medalists Category:Female ultramarathon runners Category:IAAF world record holders
title: Tomoe Abe
